subjectPost.name: Specialist (Co-operative) Program in Economicsfor Management Studies
Specialist (Co-operative) Program in Economicsfor Management Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: An introduction to basic concepts and analytical tools in financial management. Building on the fundamental concept of time value of money, the course will examine stock and bond valuations and capital budgeting under certainty. Also covered are risk-return trade-off, financial planning and forecasting, and long-term financing decisions.
cmCourseInfo.title: Principles of Finance

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Enrolment Indicator: RP

Initially restricted to students in the following groups:
SC BBA C - Bachelor of Business Administration (Co-op)
SCCRSBBA C - Bachelor of Business Administration (Co-op)

SCPRGBBA M - Management (International Business) (Co-op)
SC BBASC - Double Degree: Management and Finance Specialist Co-op (BBA) / Statistics Specialist Co-op (HBSC) - Quantitative Finance Stream
SCCRSBBASC - Double Degree: Management and Finance Specialist Co-op (BBA) / Statistics Specialist Co-op (HBSC) - Quantitative Finance Stream
SCPRGBBASC - Double Degree: Management and Finance Specialist Co-op (BBA) / Statistics Specialist Co-op (HBSC) - Quantitative Finance Stream
SCSPE01332 - Specialist (Co-operative) Program in Economics for Management Studies

At 3:00pm on March 25, 2025, enrollment will open to students in the following groups:
MGT - All Management Students

Management & Economics Co-op students have priority until 3pm on the first day of enrolment. Priority is necessary as these students must take specific Management courses in the Summer, in order to participate in the Fall/Winter work terms. Students may add other courses as soon as their course enrolment start time begins.

Visiting students need to obtain permission from the Academic Director to enroll in Management courses.

GRADUATING STUDENTS: Students graduating during June 2025 who wish to enroll in management courses during Summer 2025 may enroll in courses the usual way, but are cautioned that they may be withdrawn from courses if there are continuing undergraduate students on waitlists. Priority will be given to continuing undergraduate students who are pursuing degree or program requirements. Please see Calendar for overall course load limit for BBA students.

subjectPost.name: Specialist (Co-operative) Program in Economicsfor Management Studies
Specialist (Co-operative) Program in Economicsfor Management Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: This course covers mainstream finance topics. Besides a deeper examination of certain topics already covered in MGFB10H3, the course will investigate additional subjects such as working capital management, capital budgeting under uncertainty, cost of capital, capital structure, dividend policy, leasing, mergers and acquisitions, and international financial management.
cmCourseInfo.title: Intermediate Finance

subjectPost.name: Specialist (Co-operative) Program in Economicsfor Management Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: This course covers goal setting, personal financial statements, debt and credit management, risk management, investing in financial markets, real estate appraisal and mortgage financing, tax saving strategies, retirement and estate planning. The course will benefit students in managing their personal finances, and in their future careers with financial institutions.
cmCourseInfo.title: Personal Financial Management

subjectPost.name: Specialist (Co-operative) Program in Economicsfor Management Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: This course explores the private equity asset class and the private equity acquisition process. It covers both the academic and practical components of private equity investing, including: deal sourcing, financial modelling and valuations, transaction structuring, financing, diligence, negotiations, post transaction corporate strategy and governance.
cmCourseInfo.title: Private Equity
